美国 加利福尼亚州 洛杉矶
个人简介
I am a business analytics professional with a passion for leveraging
quantitative and qualitative data to inform decisionmaking Currently
in my first year of the MS in Business Analytics program at USC
I collaborate with a cohort of talented and diverse individuals to
tackle inclass and extracurricular projects aimed at refining business
insights and creating a reallife impact
I graduated from Carnegie Mellon University with dual degrees in
Economics & Statistics and Philosophy which may not seem like the
most intuitive combination but my interests in these disparate fields
are deeply intertwined I enjoy piecing together a consistent theory
from some of the most obscure texts ever written just as much as
uncovering patterns hidden beneath a dazzling display of data With
intellectual curiosity and enriching diverse experiences connecting
interdisciplinary ideas I add value to a variety of academic and
professional organizations by translating my analysis into actionable
insights When placed in a team setting my inclination toward an
integrative approach to problemsolving motivates me to bring top
minds together for complex tasks which are often interdisciplinary in
nature
I have a strong academic track record in conducting statistical
analysis and professional exposure to processing and extracting
insights from realworld datasets I am proficient in R Python and
MySQL with a focus on data analytics visualization and database
management A strong suit of mine is conducting literature reviews
and I particularly enjoy complementing quantitative analysis with
abundant qualitative research I believe that being datadriven is just
as important as being hypothesisdriven where domain knowledge is
crucial
  Page 1 of 3    
My industry interests lie in retail healthcare and marketing I am
actively seeking dataoriented internship opportunities in Summer
2024 with a flexible location preference for California New York
and Pittsburgh which is my second home As a Canadian citizen I
am also open to locations in Canada
I welcome any exciting challenges and eagerly seek opportunities
to grow If you have one for me please feel free to reach me via
LinkedIn direct messages

Business Analytics Professional | Experienced Creating Insights
on Global | Passion for Messy Real-Life Data with Impact | Proven
in Cross-Cultural and Cross-Functional Teams | American Eagles
Outfitters Alumni | R, SQL
美国 加利福尼亚州 洛杉矶
个人简介
I am a business analytics professional with a passion for leveraging
quantitative and qualitative data to inform decision-making. Currently
in my first year of the MS in Business Analytics program at USC,
I collaborate with a cohort of talented and diverse individuals to
tackle in-class and extracurricular projects aimed at refining business
insights and creating a real-life impact.
I graduated from Carnegie Mellon University with dual degrees in
Economics & Statistics and Philosophy, which may not seem like the
most intuitive combination, but my interests in these disparate fields
are deeply intertwined. I enjoy piecing together a consistent theory
from some of the most obscure texts ever written just as much as
uncovering patterns hidden beneath a dazzling display of data. With
intellectual curiosity and enriching, diverse experiences connecting
interdisciplinary ideas, I add value to a variety of academic and
professional organizations by translating my analysis into actionable
insights. When placed in a team setting, my inclination toward an
integrative approach to problem-solving motivates me to bring top
minds together for complex tasks, which are often interdisciplinary in
nature.
I have a strong academic track record in conducting statistical
analysis and professional exposure to processing and extracting
insights from real-world datasets. I am proficient in R, Python, and
MySQL, with a focus on data analytics, visualization, and database
management. A strong suit of mine is conducting literature reviews,
and I particularly enjoy complementing quantitative analysis with
abundant qualitative research. I believe that being data-driven is just
as important as being hypothesis-driven, where domain knowledge is
crucial.
  Page 1 of 3    
My industry interests lie in retail, healthcare, and marketing. I am
actively seeking data-oriented internship opportunities in Summer
2024, with a flexible location preference for California, New York,
and Pittsburgh, which is my second home. As a Canadian citizen, I
am also open to locations in Canada.
I welcome any exciting challenges and eagerly seek opportunities
to grow. If you have one for me, please feel free to reach me via
LinkedIn direct messages!
工作经历

(Customer Data Platform) project to understand the project manage timeline,
the technical implementation, and the value of the project for marketers.
Carnegie Mellon University

2021 年 9 月 - 2021 年 12 月  (4 个月)
Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, United States
Worked as teaching assistant for Introduction to Probability. Held weekly office
hours via Zoom and graded homework.
Honeycomb Credit
Data Analyst
2021 年 5 月 - 2021 年 7 月  (3 个月)
Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, United States
Ran data analysis with R to provide actionable insights for marketing,
sales, and campaign management teams. Created data visualizations and
  Page 2 of 3    
PowerPoint presentations. Extracted data from CRM platforms such as Google
Analytics and Hubspot. Worked with Google Meeting, Slack and Airtable.
Carnegie Mellon University

2020 年 6 月 - 2020 年 8 月  (3 个月)
Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, United States
Compiled literature review for Professor Zollman on the research topic of
Network Epistemology. Specifically looked into literature on propaganda,
misinformation and polarization that has implications for computational
modeling of networks.
